segments.text: The moment I step into the kitchen, I see it all unfolding.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman’s expression is blissfully unaware as she dries her plate, lost in thought.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can feel my heart race a little as I glance at the overflowing sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost comical how the water doesn’t seem to bother her at all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Then my eyes shift to the boy, climbing up on that unstable stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What is he thinking? Doesn’t he know how dangerous that is?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can see the jar of cookies just calling to him, but at what cost?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl looks so hopeful with her hand raised, and I can't help but feel a little pit in my stomach.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They shouldn't be doing this when she’s right there, oblivious to the chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sunlit garden outside feels like it’s mocking the mess in here.
segments.speaker: PAR
